title: Drawing, "Frederick B. Patterson Apartment: Library Elevation", 1931
medium: Graphite and red ink on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in red ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower right: PROPOSED TREATMENT/OF LIBRARY/MRS. F. PATTERSON/RIVER HOUSE NEW YORK
description: Elevations for library showing furniture placement. In elevation at upper left, three-seat upholstered sofa at left, bookshelves behind sofa and at left. End table with sculptural figure to right of sofa. Vertical paned windows at right with drape pulled to far right. Elevation at upper right shows windows at left, with drape pulled to far left; bookshelf (?) at right. Lower left elevation shows fireplace at right with sculptural figure on top of mantel at left; bookshelves/cabinet at left. Entrance to room at far right. Elevation at lower right shows doorway at center of wall flanked by tall bookshelves on each side.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Frederick B. Patterson Apartment: Library Elevation", 1931.
1931. Graphite and red ink on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-1007.
